intro: Tithymalus campestris, commonly known as field tithymale, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are pinnately lobed and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. Tithymalus campestris is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
